Container.Name: unmanic
Container.Overview: [br]Unmanic is a simple tool for optimising your video library to a single format. [br]Remove the complexity of automatically converting your media library. [br]Simply point Unmanic at your library and let it manage it for you. [br] [br][b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Nvidia GPU Use[/span][/u][/b] [br] 1) Install the Unraid Nvidia Plugin to install a version of Unraid with the Nvidia Drivers installed. [br] 2) Toggle this Docker Container template editor to [b]"Advanced View"[/b]. [br] 3) In the [b]"Extra Parameters"[/b] field, add "[b]--runtime=nvidia[/b]". [br] 4) Expand the template "Show more settings..." section. [br] 5) In the [b]"NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES"[/b] variable, copy your [b]GPU UUID[/b] (can be found in the Unraid Nvidia Plugin) [br] [br][b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Intel GPU Use[/span][/u][/b] [br] 1) Edit your [b]go[/b] file to include: "[b]modprobe i915[/b]". [br] 2) Save and reboot Unraid. [br] 3) Toggle this Docker Container template editor to [b]"Advanced View"[/b]. [br] 4) In the [b]"Extra Parameters"[/b] field, add "[b]--device=/dev/dri[/b]". [br]

Config.Name: Nvidia GPU UUID
Config.Description: Container Variable: NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES (Required only for Nvidia GPU hardware accelerated encoding)
